Removing the reference holder from Command class breaks Command and Query Executors Tests, as it is no longer possible to copy Command objects. To make this work, a Command mock factory was created in previous PR, and this one reworks CommandExecutorTest with that factory. QueryExecutorTest will be covered in next PR.

### Benefits

No more real Command where it is not needed.

### Possible Drawbacks 

None.

title: Commands Mocks Factory
body:
### Description of the Change

This PR introduces mocks for commands and a factory, which creates those mocks, so that it will be possible to use them in places, where the actual commands are not needed, such as both ExecutorTest-s.

### Benefits

Less dependencies in future.

### Possible Drawbacks 

None.

title: Consensus BFT 5f+1
body:
[IR-109](https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/IR-109)


### Description of the Change

YAC supermajority changed according to `5f+1` model, where `f` is the number of faulty peers. This means that now the network having `5f+1` peers (or more) can tolerate arbitrary behaviour of `f` malicious peers.  

### Benefits

Solves the BFT issues.

title: YAC shares last outcome with laggy peer
body:
[IR-95](https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/IR-95)

### Description of the Change

Before this change, if peer A sends vote with round {3, 0} to peer B while is is in round {5,2}, then peer B sends back the outcome for round {3, 0}. After this change the peer B will send the outcome for {5,2}.

### Benefits

Correct behaviour. Faster synchronization.

title: Fix uncommitted cache

<!-- You will not see HTML commented line in Pull Request body -->
<!-- Optional sections may be omitted. Just remove them or write None -->

<!-- * All new code must have code coverage above 70% (https://docs.codecov.io/docs/about-code-coverage). -->
<!-- * CircleCI builds must be passed. -->
<!-- * Critical and blocker issues reported by Sorabot must be fixed. -->
<!-- * Branch must be rebased onto base branch (https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/11173889/Rebase+and+merge+guide). -->


### Description of the Change

Previously uncommitted transactions cache was removing by reduced hash of transaction batch. However block event emitted to ordering gate returns hashes of transactions. So the fix removes batches from the cache by transaction's hash. So, if any batch in transaction cache contains transaction with given transaction hash, then entire batch with that transaction is removed from the cache

### Benefits

No more duplication warnings

### Possible Drawbacks 

None

### Usage Examples or Tests

on_demand_cache_test with remove function was updated

title: Print user-defined objects to log directly
body:
### Description of the Change

Previously, user-defined objects were printed into the log via calling their `toString()` method, which is not very efficient. This PR introduces an ability to log such objects directly, and their `toString()` will be called only if level of logging meets the one turned on.

### Benefits

No more additional logging overhead when unnecessary.

### Possible Drawbacks 

None.

This PR adds to [NTF NX](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1apu-RndZMBFX51BxDoZTBzIY8s11coS8EeRGV3HqViE/edit?usp=sharing) (Integration Testing Framework Network eXtension), aka Fake Peers, some new features, as pre-on-demand ordering service & synchronizer support, behaviour strategies, new usage example and some refactoring.

### Benefits

Improved NTF NX.

title: Query Stateful Validation Error Codes
body:
### Description of the Change

Commands have set of stateful validation error codes, but queries still had just error messages. This PR introduces error codes, described in the following [POW](https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/439189508/POW+N+075+Stateful+response).

### Benefits

Unified way to pass error message to the client.

### Possible Drawbacks 

None.

- Since it is not possible to create block query from storage after it has been dropped, each `getBlockQuery` call should be checked for `nullptr` after call.
- It is also possible to catch an exception when SQL query is executed. `PostgresBlockQuery::checkTxPresence` is refactored with try-catch for this reason.

title: Fix Synchronizer
body:
Signed-off-by: Igor Egorov <igor@soramitsu.co.jp>

### Description of the Change

Synchronyzer's algorithm is fixed.

Synchronizer was not able to sync when too many transactions were arriving.

The root cause is:
The synchronizer is triggered by some commit A.
The network was able to apply commit B on top of A.
The peer that requested missing blocks receives pre-A, A, B commits.
The peer checks that the hash of the last received block equals to A hash.
The check is failed -> sync is not done.

### Benefits

Fixed synchronizer.
The [issue](https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/IR-46) cannot be reproduced.

### Possible Drawbacks 

Only existing tests are available.
The test that sets up four nodes and checks the case is missing.
Implementing of such test suite will cost too much by now. 

### Usage Examples or Tests

block_loader_test
ametsuchi_test
synchronyzer_test


Thanks to @lebdron for tips and involvement

title: Feature/oneof block
body:
<!-- You will not see HTML commented line in Pull Request body -->
<!-- Optional sections may be omitted. Just remove them or write None -->

<!-- * Filling out the template is required. Any pull request that does not include enough information to be reviewed in a timely manner may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- * All new code must have code coverage above 70% (https://docs.codecov.io/docs/about-code-coverage). -->
<!-- * CircleCI builds must be passed. -->
<!-- * Critical and blocker issues reported by Sorabot must be fixed. -->
<!-- * Branch must be rebased onto base branch (https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/11173889/Rebase+and+merge+guide). -->


### Description of the Change
Before it was:

```
message Block {
  // block_v1 fields
}
```

From now on it will be
```
message Block_v1 {
// block_v1 fields
}

message Block {
  oneof block_version {
    Block_v1 block_v1 = 1;
  }
}
```

Such changes would allow us to introduce Block_v2 and further versions, by simply adding them to oneof in Block message. Internally we will be able to recognize and manage different version of the blocks.

### Benefits

Iroha will be able to process different versions of the blocks.

### Possible Drawbacks 

Format of genesis block is changing. So if you used old iroha, you will not be able to use old block store

Bugs.

title: Schema update for queries with lists of transactions
body:
### Description of the Change

[IR-20](https://jira.hyperledger.org/projects/IR/issues/IR-20)
This change adds the pagination metadata to some queries that request transaction lists: GetAccountTransactions and GetAccountAssetTransactions. It does not concern GetPendingTransactions as it is expected to be rewritten soon.

### Benefits

A small step towards great feature.

### Possible Drawbacks 

bugs.

### Usage Examples or Tests

When a client requests some sort of transaction list, the request must include pagination metadata. That one _must_ have the page size set  to the maximum amount of transactions the client wants to get at once, and _may_ have the first transaction hash field set to the hash of the transaction, from which the returned list is supposed to start.

This change makes OdOs Connection Manager aware of the round for which its destination peers are valid. Now it will wait for the peers data to update if the batch it gets has a newer round, or set the destination of the batch to an actual round if the requested destination is outdated.

### Benefits

Aimed at mitigation of (one of causes of) [the lost proposal bug|https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/browse/IR-1888].

### Possible Drawbacks 

Bugs!

title: Generate secrets for Iroha peers in k8s and add persisted storage.
body:
Signed-off-by: bagf

<!-- You will not see HTML commented line in Pull Request body -->
<!-- Optional sections may be omitted. Just remove them or write None -->

<!-- ### Requirements -->
<!-- * Filling out the template is required. Any pull request that does not include enough information to be reviewed in a timely manner may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- * All new code must have code coverage above 70% (https://docs.codecov.io/docs/about-code-coverage). -->
<!-- * CircleCI builds must be passed. -->
<!-- * Critical and blocker issues reported by Sorabot must be fixed. -->
<!-- * Branch must be rebased onto base branch (https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/11173889/Rebase+and+merge+guide). -->


### Description of the Change

<!-- We must be able to understand the design of your change from this description. If we can't get a good idea of what the code will be doing from the description here, the pull request may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- Keep in mind that the maintainer reviewing this PR may not be familiar with or have worked with the code here recently, so please walk us through the concepts. -->

Currently k8s-iroha Ansible playbook uses a Python script to save each peer key pair to `files/conf`. The command `kubectl create configmap` should be called afterwards to save the: peer key pairs, genesis block and config to Kubernetes.

This PR will generate secrets in k8s-peer-keys.yaml alongside the statefulset in k8s-iroha.yaml. The statefulset will use a init container (busybox) to copy create peer keys for each pod. I see this as a temporary implementation, once PodPresets become available there wont be any need to copy the keys before the Iroha container starts.

Additionally persistent volumes will be requested for both the Postgres and Iroha block store volumes. `emptyDir` was used previously which would forget data between restarts. If this temporary store feature is required I can implement a config option to use `emptyDir` for storage in the statefulset.

### Benefits

<!-- What benefits will be realized by the code change? -->

- Each Iroha peer gets it's own Kubernetes Secret, each pod can only read it's allocated Secret.
- Resulting Configmap is smaller as it doesn't need to store any key pair files.
- Persistent storage now configurable for both Postgres and Iroha's block store.

### Possible Drawbacks 

<!-- What are the possible side-effects or negative impacts of the code change? -->
<!-- If no drawbacks, explicitly mention this (write None) -->

- Temporary storage for statefulset no longer used. As mentioned above I can add it if needed
- Slightly more complicated pod initialization
- Postgres starts in the same pod and might not be ready when irohad tries to connect (sleep was used previously, might use it again that if there isn't a better option)

### Usage Examples or Tests *[optional]*

<!-- Point reviewers to the test, code example or documentation which shows usage example of this feature -->

### Alternate Designs *[optional]*

<!-- Explain what other alternates were considered and why the proposed version was selected -->

PodPresets should work well when the cluster supports them. This solution was tested on 1.9 and 1.10 without any issues / modifications to the cluster configuration.

Alternative secrets implementation using PodPresets: https://github.com/CastleOne/iroha/blob/k8s-ansible-secrets-pod-preset/deploy/ansible/roles/iroha-k8s/templates/k8s-peer-keys.yaml.j2#L13-L28

title: Fix startup flags logic (--genesis_block & --overwrite_ledger)
body:
Signed-off-by: Igor Egorov <igor@soramitsu.co.jp>

### Description of the Change

This is a better implementation of #1776.

The problem is that CI needs to be able to launch `irohad` that will restore the existing state with the same set of flags as that was passed at the first launch.

The new way of launch parameters handling is implemented. All the possible cases is covered.

The new truth table is below:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36847043/48899324-5d09e200-ee60-11e8-9cfa-f7cd27cca576.png)


For a better understanding of changes made in code please take a look at two execution flowcharts (old and new one).
#### Old execution flow
![old_flow](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36847043/48899420-9cd0c980-ee60-11e8-9e26-508e4b3bd6f1.png)
#### New execution flow
![new_flow](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36847043/48899434-a5290480-ee60-11e8-920f-7132b375bc86.png)


### Benefits

Nothing is changed in already exposed API.
No unexpected behavior is added.
All the combinations of three parameters (presence of blockstore, presence of new genesis_block, presence of overwrite_ledger flag) are covered.


### Possible Drawbacks 

None?

### Usage Examples or Tests

```
cmake -H. -Bbuild
cd build
make irohad_test
test_bin/irohad_test
```

title: Stateful Error Response to Log
body:
### Description of the Change

Completely removing the stateful error message was a bad idea, because clients now do not have an ability to track down actual query parameters, hidden behind the error code. So, this PR introduces output of query parameters to the log.

### Benefits

More verbose output to developers.

### Possible Drawbacks 

None

### Usage Examples or Tests

`postgres_executor_test` is updated with query parameters checks.

title: Prevent replay attack on MST state sharing
body:
Signed-off-by: Igor Egorov <igor@soramitsu.co.jp>

### Description of the Change

A peer can receive the same MST state from the network more than once.
As the result, sometimes the same transaction was able to be committed multiple times.

### Benefits

Replays on MST state sharing are prevented.


### Possible Drawbacks 

Missing test. (in progress. to be updated soon)


### Usage Examples or Tests

Special test is under development. The pr will be updated soon

title: Fix MST SendState segfault
body:
Signed-off-by: Igor Egorov <igor@soramitsu.co.jp>

### Description of the Change

It was possible to cause a segfault in Iroha by sharing MST state that contains a transaction with non-typed command.

Now such states are handled correctly - they are dropped during proto validation.

The test is created.


Now proto validators are used for transactions as it was desired initially.

### Benefits

Improved stability and code coverage.

### Possible Drawbacks 

Once a day, non-proto transaction validator can be accidentally used.

### Usage Examples or Tests

```
make transport_test
test_bin/transport_test
```

title: Fix SetAccountQuorum validation rule
body:
Signed-off-by: Igor Egorov <igor@soramitsu.co.jp>

### Description of the Change

SetAccountQuorum validation rule had inverse logic.
It was not possible to set the quorum less than a number of linked signatories.
The true validation rule is - it is not allowed to set the quorum more than a number of linked signatories.

### Benefits

Fixed validation behavior.
Increased code coverage.


### Possible Drawbacks 

none ?

### Usage Examples or Tests

```
cmake -H. -Bbuild
cd build
make set_account_quorum_test
test_bin/set_account_quorum_test
```

title: ITF: PortGuard
body:
### Description of the Change

Meet integration_framework::PortGuard - a class that keeps track of ports you use in ITF tests! Just add an instance in your class where you allocate ports, and ask it for some in a given range. When your class dies (sorry), it will in its final moments mark the ports your instance requested as free.

### Benefits

It should make port reusing easier.

### Possible Drawbacks 

It uses locks for synchronization.

title: Refactor torii_service_test
body:
### Description of the Change

Finally these awful test are started to be refactored. First on the list is torii_service_test. It was splitted to the CommandSyncClient part (with server) and CommandServiceTransportGrpc (with only mocks)

### Benefits

Cleaner test code for one more component

### Possible Drawbacks 

None

### Usage Examples or Tests

`torii_transport_command_test` and `command_sync_client_test` targets are affected

### Alternate Designs

There's an awful workaround with using `reinterpret_cast` for deriving from a final class (that basically an UB, but works meh). Fortunately it's only required for tests. Two alternatives that I can see right now is class interface extension and gRPC patching. Probably the first one is better, though quite tough to make it in the same pr. Here the block of nasty code
https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/blob/c4d5e368da12969cff7e8e6be16ce16cde3019bd/test/module/irohad/torii/torii_transport_command_test.cpp#L282-L289

body:
### Description of the Change

Fake peers already have handles to receive and send arbitrary data over MST, YAC, OG&OS gRPC interface. This patch adds behaviour classes in order to simulate different kinds of peer environment. Implemented are the following behaviours: honest peer, slow honest peer, unresponsive peer.

### Benefits

New testing tools.

### Possible Drawbacks 

Bugs.

title: Stateful Response Error Codes
body:
### Description of the Change

This PR trunk introduces error codes for stateful response. Numeric values, described in the following [POW](https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/439189508/POW+N+075+Stateful+response), are returned the to the client instead of long and insecure error messages.

### Benefits

More security and easier to parse by the client.

### Possible Drawbacks 

Less information about the error, which happened during validation.

The Iroha Documentation has been changed as per the **Hyperledger Internship 2018** Quarter 3 specifications. Mentored by **Ankit Raj.** This changed documentation contains the following changes:

- **Iroha API Reference** (Commands Section): It has been modified with the JSON formats which were previously missing. 
- **Python Library Section**: It has been changed to add the Python Library Installation and an example of using Python Client Library 
- **NodeJS Library Section**: It has been changed to add the Node Library Installation and an example of using Node Library.
- **CLI**: Command Line Interface Section has been added in Core Concepts along with images for demonstration. 

### Benefits

The documentation has been changed for the ease of reading the concepts and understanding them along with the addition of the missing parts of the documentation to make the documentation complete.

### Possible Drawbacks 

None. No codes have been altered. Only Documentation changes.

title: A test for basic case of transaction replay attack
body:
Signed-off-by: Igor Egorov <igor@soramitsu.co.jp>

### Description of the Change

Adds a test that sends the same transaction (copies are bit-exact) two times and expects that the second transaction should not be processed and committed.

### Benefits

Increased coverage.

### Possible Drawbacks 

The test is disabled now. It should be enabled after IR-1773 and IR-1838.


title: Hyperledger Iroha v1.0 beta-5 version
body:
We are happy to introduce various improvements of Hyperledger Iroha for beta-5 release and tell you more about what we accomplished together.

There were several major features implemented or prepared:

## Multi-signature Transaction (MST)
Now you can request several signatures to verify the transaction. And transactions can receive 2 more statuses: MST_PENDING for transactions waiting for more signatures and ENOUGH_SIGNATURES_COLLECTED for transactions that have already received the number of signatures requested (https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1649).

**Known issues**: 
1. Iroha can apply multi-signature transactions several times, due to lack of transaction replay protection.
2. When a user sends a completed MST transaction then it is not removed from MST storage, so when one asks for their pending transactions they will still see it. As a temporary workaround, you can remove all signatures after getting pending transactions and then sign them with your signature(s) and send to Iroha.

We have made MST possible with the following changes: 
    - adding Storage for Pending Transactions: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1598
    - fixed sending batches to the Storage and retrieving them:  https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1661
    - fixed retrieval of pending MST transactions: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1661
    - MST batches: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1642 and client tests for them: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1652
    and other improvements. 

Here is the example of MST use case: Alice and Bob are performing exchange between bitcoin and dogecoin using MST to perform exchange only when both participants agreed on the transfer https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1761

## New fully BFT On-Demand Ordering Service is almost ready (only needs some finishing touches)!
Impressive preparations were made for later assembly of fully BFT (Byzantine-fault tolerant) Ordering service. We already prepared:
 - BFT OS algorithm and interfaces: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1670
 - on-demand ordering gate: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1675
 - the transport: #1635  and on-demand connection manager: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1645
 - the synchronizer: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1647
 - BFT OS components: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1703
 - Consensus Round as Key in YacStorages: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1729
 - BFT YacGate: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1731

**Important note:** at the moment Iroha uses an old version of Ordering Service, which will be obsolete in the next release (later this month).

## Replaced builders with factories 
Now the code runs faster with the changed design of its components. 
Here are our new factories within the code:
 - factory for a block: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1622
 - factory for transaction status creation: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1717
 - factory for query responses and tests: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1724
 - abstract factory for creating batches from transactions: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1743
 - transport factory: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1750

## Query Error Responses
Real error reasons for real people using Iroha — introducing Query Error Responses so you could know why the query failed: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1770

## And some of the smaller though very important ones:

### Optimized SQL queries for Iroha commands and queries 
A complex work was done to optimize the work of SQL for both commands and queries: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1605

### Consensus Cache in Block Loader and YAC Gate
We constantly move towards faster Iroha. Now there is no need for a node to wait time to ask another node for synchronization thanks to the consensus cache. So let us say good-bye to load_delay: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1627

### SWIG-free Iroha library for Python
Platform independent. Lighter. A better solution if you want to use Python with Iroha: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1761

### SubtractAssetQuantity command
Was not previously implemented in Iroha-cli but now works correctly with AddAssetQuantity: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1713

### Benchmarks to measure performance 
We are introducing a benchmark that executes a GetAccount query and a benchmark that executes AddAssetQuantity command to have more information on the performance: #1651 and #1648 

### Empty Roles
The purpose of append role command is to promote an account to some created role in the system, where a role is a set of permissions account has to perform an action (command or query). It was impossible to add a role without permissions to account. Now it is possible: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1654

### reducedHash
a reducedHash wrapper is now visible to libraries and can be called by clients: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1659

### TransactionBatchParser
Splits a list of transactions by possible adjacent batches: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1750

### Genesis Parser 
It will generate a nice MD file with tables of accounts, permissions and other parameters of the genesis block: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1775


## Improved tests
Here are some of the most influential results:

- the ability to send transaction sequences to the ITF and check stateless valid/invalid status: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1660
ITF feature of checking all the specified statuses: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1720

## DevOps news
CMake version
Minimum CMake version requirement is now 3.11.2 to use cool new features of it in Iroha: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1667

Iroha on Kubernetes cluster
Now Iroha can be run on Kubernetes: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1697

---

If there are any questions on the release or if you would like to help us with the next one, please check out our contacts under the “Need help” paragraph: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha#need-help

title: Hyperledger Iroha v1.0 beta-5 version
body:
We are happy to introduce various improvements of Hyperledger Iroha for Beta-5 release and tell you more about what we accomplished together.

There were several major features implemented or prepared…

## Multi-signature Transaction (MST) is ready for use!
Now you can request several signatures to verify the transaction. And transactions can receive 2 more statuses: MST_PENDING for transactions waiting for more signatures and ENOUGH_SIGNATURES_COLLECTED for transactions that have already received the number of signatures requested ( https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1649). 

We have made MST possible with the following changes: 
	- adding Storage for Pending Transactions: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1598
	- fixed sending batches to the Storage and retrieving them:  https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1661
	- fixed retrieval of pending MST transactions: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1661
	- MST batches: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1642 and client tests for them: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1652
	and other improvements. 

Here is the example of MST use case: Alice and Bob are performing exchange between bitcoin and dogecoin using MST to perform exchange only when both partcipants agreed on the transfer https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1761

**Important note:** MST is functional. However, there is a known issue: when user sends a completed MST transaction it's version without all signatures is not removed from MST storage, so when one asks for his pending transactions he will still see it. As a temporary workaround, you can remove all signatures after getting pending transactions and then sign them with your signature and send to Iroha.

## New fully BFT On-Demand Ordering Service is almost ready (only needs some finishing touches)!
Impressive preparations were made for later assembly of fully BFT (Byzantine-fault tolerant) Ordering service. We already prepared:
 - BFT OS algorithm and interfaces: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1670
 - on-demand ordering gate: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1675
 - the transport: #1635  and on-demand connection manager: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1645
 - the synchroniser: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1647
 - BFT OS components: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1703
 - Consensus Round as Key in YacStorages: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1729
 - BFT YacGate: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1731

**Important note: ** at the moment Iroha uses old version of Ordreing Service, which will be obsolete in the next release

## Replaced builders with factories 
Now the code runs faster with changed design of its components. 
Here are our new factories within the code:
 - factory for a block: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1622
 - factory for transaction status creation: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1717
 - factory for query responses and tests: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1724
 - abstract factory for creating batches from transactions: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1743
 - transport factory: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1750

## Query Error Responses
Real error reasons for real people using Iroha - introducing Query Error Responses so you could know why the query failed: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1770

## And some of the smaller though very important ones…

### Optimised command and query SQL
A complex work was done to optimise the work of SQL for both commands and queries: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1605

### Consensus Cache in Block Loader and YAC Gate
We constantly move towards faster Iroha. 
Now there is no need for a node to wait time to ask another node for synchronisation thanks to the consensus cache. So let us say good-bye to load_delay: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1627

### SWIG-free Iroha library for Python
Platform independent. Lighter. 
Better solution if you want to use Python with Iroha: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1761

### SubtractAssetQuantity command
Was not previously implemented in Iroha-cli but now works correctly with AddAssetQuantity: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1713

### Benchmarks to measure performance 
We are introducing a benchmark that executes GetAccount query and a benchmark that executes AddAssetQuantity command to have more information on the performance: #1651  and #1648 

### Empty Roles
The purpose of append role command is to promote an account to some created role in the system, where a role is a set of permissions account has to perform an action (command or query). It was impossible to add a role without permissions to account. Now it is possible: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1654

### reducedHash
reducedHash wrapper is now visible to libraries and can be called by clients: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1659

### TransactionBatchParser
Splits a list of transactions by possible adjacent batches: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1750

### Genesis Parser 
It will generate a nice md file with tables of accounts, permissions and other parameters of the genesis block: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1775


## Improved tests
Here are some of the most influential results:

- the ability to send transaction sequences to the ITF and check stateless valid/invalid status: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1660
ITF feature of checking all the specified statuses: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1720


## Fixes
Please also make sure to check out some important fixes and see if your Iroha is not affected by them: 
 - freeConnections method, which disposes all currently used connections was fixed: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1727
 - send tx sequence method: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1685

## DevOps news
CMake version
Minimum CMake version requirement is now 3.11.2 to use cool new features of it in Iroha: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1667

Iroha on Kubernetes cluster
Now Iroha can be run on Kubernetes: https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1697

title: New transaction status: rejected before
body:
### Description of the Change

New transaction status means that this transaction has already been submitted, but failed stateful validation. Such transaction can not be applied for execution any more.

### Benefits

Fulfilling the need for the new status.

### Possible Drawbacks 

To be found.

title: Store rejected transactions' hashes in blockchain
body:
### Description of the Change

The hashes of transactions rejected after proposal verification by simulator are passed to block creator along with the verified proposal. Then these hashes are added to a newly created field in the block.

### Benefits

The rejected transactions' hashes stored in the blockchain let us guarantee a client that certain transaction was rejected and will never be executed.

### Possible Drawbacks 

A malicious peer can bloat the blockchain with tons of fake invalid transactions' hashes.

title: Uncommitted caching
body:
<!-- You will not see HTML commented line in Pull Request body -->
<!-- Optional sections may be omitted. Just remove them or write None -->

<!-- ### Requirements -->
<!-- * Filling out the template is required. Any pull request that does not include enough information to be reviewed in a timely manner may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- * All new code must have code coverage above 70% (https://docs.codecov.io/docs/about-code-coverage). -->
<!-- * CircleCI builds must be passed. -->
<!-- * Critical and blocker issues reported by Sorabot must be fixed. -->
<!-- * Branch must be rebased onto base branch (https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/11173889/Rebase+and+merge+guide). -->


### Description of the Change

Adds caching of uncommitted transactions. Cache works as the queue of batches collections. Queue's size is always 3. It works as follows:

#### `OnDemandOrderingGate::propagateBatch(Batch B)` is invoked:

given the following state of the cache:

```
head
1. {a, b, c}
2. {d, e}
3. {f, g}
tail
```

1. The batches from the head of the queue are concatenated with the batch
`batches = {a, b, c, B}`
2. Batches are sent to network
3. The head of the queue is cleaned
```
1. {}
2. {d, e}
3. {f, g}
```
4. Batches are added to the tail of the queue
```
1. {}
2. {d, e}
3. {f, g, a, b, c, B}
```

#### `BlockEvent` containing batches {a,b} is received from OS:
given the following state of the cache:

```
head
1. {a, b, c}
2. {d, e}
3. {f, g}
tail
```

1. `up` is invoked, which shifts all BatchLists towards the head. Batches from the middle ({d, e} in example) are concatenated with head batches ({a,b,c}):
```
1. {a, b, c, d, e}
2. {f, g}
3. {}
```
2. All batches from the event ({a,b}) are removed from the top:
```
1. {c, d, e}
2. {f, g}
3. {}
```

### Benefits

The transactions that were not committed will be resent to the network

### Possible Drawbacks 

The logic of the caching can be too sophisticated, and probably can be somehow simplified
### Usage Examples or Tests

Tests for cache and for on demand ordering gate with cache added 

### Alternate Designs

Live without caching

title: Fix bug with 100% peer load
body:
Signed-off-by: Akvinikym <anarant12@gmail.com>

<!-- You will not see HTML commented line in Pull Request body -->
<!-- Optional sections may be omitted. Just remove them or write None -->

<!-- ### Requirements -->
<!-- * Filling out the template is required. Any pull request that does not include enough information to be reviewed in a timely manner may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- * All new code must have code coverage above 70% (https://docs.codecov.io/docs/about-code-coverage). -->
<!-- * CircleCI builds must be passed. -->
<!-- * Critical and blocker issues reported by Sorabot must be fixed. -->
<!-- * Branch must be rebased onto base branch (https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/11173889/Rebase+and+merge+guide). -->


### Description of the Change

Bug with 100%+ Iroha node overload was appearing because of block streaming service, which was based into RxCpp blocking observable. In version, used in current Iroha, it had a serious issue - spinlock - which was addressed here and fixed August 6 2018. So, this pull request updated a version of RxCpp up to the current one.

### Benefits

No more useless node overload.

### Possible Drawbacks 

With the current RxCpp version it seems that it is not sufficient to `#include <rxcpp/rx-observable.hpp>`, but a whole `#include <rxcpp/rx.hpp>`, which can theoretically lead to increased compilation time.

### Usage Examples or Tests

The use case can be tested manually through Python's scripts `blocks-query.py`, which is to launched first, and then `tx-example.py`. Because of subscription to blocks in the first script, the 100% load appeared before fixing the bug. Now, it isn't.

title: Move signatories validation to SQL
body:
<!-- You will not see HTML commented line in Pull Request body -->

<!-- * Branch must be rebased onto base branch (https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/11173889/Rebase+and+merge+guide). -->


### Description of the Change
Move stateful signatures validation to SQL.
1. Reduce the number of database queries. Single query used to perform the required validation.
2. Reduce the number of data fetches. Since signatories are not required to be fetched from database, only a single fetch is done instead of number of signatures.
<!-- We must be able to understand the design of your change from this description. If we can't get a good idea of what the code will be doing from the description here, the pull request may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- Keep in mind that the maintainer reviewing this PR may not be familiar with or have worked with the code here recently, so please walk us through the concepts. -->

### Benefits
Increased performance. Execution time of bm_pipeline benchmark on a test machine was 5000ms before, and the changes have brought it down to 4500ms.
<!-- What benefits will be realized by the code change? -->

### Possible Drawbacks 
More ambiguous error message since a single error type is returned from the database.

title: MST/transport: send source public key in MstState
body:
Also make state storage identify peers by their public keys.

### Description of the Change

Before this change MstState messages consisted of a transactions batch and the destination peer description. The receiving part interpreted the peer description as the source peer which the message came from, which is obviously an error.

In this patch, I replaced the peer description part of MstState message with the source peer's public key, which the receiving part uses to identify the receiver. Note that this change is not addressing the authentication of message.

### Benefits

Fixed the MST State propagation.

### Possible Drawbacks 

Yet to be found.

title: Refactor release Dockerfile
body:
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Vaneev <warchantua@gmail.com>

<!-- You will not see HTML commented line in Pull Request body -->
<!-- Optional sections may be omitted. Just remove them or write None -->

<!-- ### Requirements -->
<!-- * Filling out the template is required. Any pull request that does not include enough information to be reviewed in a timely manner may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- * All new code must have code coverage above 70% (https://docs.codecov.io/docs/about-code-coverage). -->
<!-- * CircleCI builds must be passed. -->
<!-- * Critical and blocker issues reported by Sorabot must be fixed. -->
<!-- * Branch must be rebased onto base branch (https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/11173889/Rebase+and+merge+guide). -->


### Description of the Change

<!-- We must be able to understand the design of your change from this description. If we can't get a good idea of what the code will be doing from the description here, the pull request may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- Keep in mind that the maintainer reviewing this PR may not be familiar with or have worked with the code here recently, so please walk us through the concepts. -->

1. Use env variables instead of fixed parameter names (config.docker, genesis.block)
2. Autodetect `postgres host` and `blocks dir` based on config json (by cost of installing small `jq` utility in release Dockerfile).
3. Enable error mode (`-e`) and debug mode (`-x`), so that you don't need to `echo` all variables to get their values. Output will be something like 
    ```
    + GENESISBLOCK_PATH=genesis.block
    + CONFIG_PATH=config.docker
    + POSTGRES_PORT=5432
    ++ cat config.docker
    ++ jq -r .pg_opt
    ++ grep -Eo 'host=(.*?)\s'
    ++ cut -d= -f2
    ++ xargs
    ++ cat config.docker
    ++ jq -r .block_store_path
    + BLOCKS_PATH=/blocks
    + POSTGRES_HOST=iroha.postgres
    ```
4. Change `ENTRYPOINT` to `CMD`: idiomatically entrypoint works as a prerequisite script for CMD. Example:
    ```
    $ docker run -it --entrypoint /bin/bash -xe -c ubuntu "echo 1"
    # is the same as
    $ docker run -it ubuntu /bin/bash -xe -c "echo 1"
    ```
    So, when blocking entrypoint is defined (as version before change), any commands `docker exec -it <container> bash` will be also blocked. This change fixes this behavior.
5. Add `wait-for-it.sh` inside container, so it will not fail if that script called.
6. Add grpc healthcheck

### Benefits

1-2. Flexible deployment
3. If error mode is enabled, then all scripts succeeded (expected behavior). If debug mode is enabled, then you can see what commands were executed, what what variables were passed to env vars.
4. Now you can do `docker run -it <container> bash`. Before change, it did not work.
5. Bugfix, which could let container fail.
6. Other tools that can check docker healthcheck can now check if iroha is started

### Possible Drawbacks 

<!-- What are the possible side-effects or negative impacts of the code change? -->
<!-- If no drawbacks, explicitly mention this (write None) -->

You may forget to call `/run-iroha.sh` from the `/opt/iroha_data` dir and end up with bash errors because default variables contain paths in "current dir". By default `/run-iroha.sh` is called from the workdir, so this is not really a drawback.

title: Fix bug with node synchronization
body:
### Description of the Change

Bug appears, when one of nodes goes down and then tries to synchronize itself with other ones, but at least one commit was accepted during its down state, and new consensus round started. Then, it tried to download block from the last round, but on other peers this block was already substituted by a new one in consensus cache, leading to result that BlockLoader did not give it, taking that node into an infinite loop.
Bug fix makes BlockLoader to look to the BlockStorage after the cache missed.

### Benefits

This bug went away.

### Possible Drawbacks 

No.

title: Update ansible deployment playbooks and roles
body:
<!-- You will not see HTML commented line in Pull Request body -->
<!-- Optional sections may be omitted. Just remove them or write None -->

<!-- ### Requirements -->
<!-- * Filling out the template is required. Any pull request that does not include enough information to be reviewed in a timely manner may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->

<!-- * Critical and blocker issues reported by Sorabot must be fixed. -->
<!-- * Branch must be rebased onto base branch (https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/11173889/Rebase+and+merge+guide). -->


### Description of the Change

1. This PR removes duplicity from ansible deployment playbooks.

4 roles are removed:
- `iroha-standalone-config-gen`
- `iroha-cluster-config-gen`
- `iroha-standalone-deploy-node`
- `iroha-cluster-deploy-node`

2 roles are introduced:
- `iroha-config-gen`
- `iroha-nodes`

2. The issues with iroha deployment are finally fixed:
- no more confusion in `config.sample` or `config.docker` files
- no more outdated configuration in `config.docker` files

3. Fixed dependencies - no more `iroha-cli` required.  `ed25519-cli` is now shipped with this ansible playbook. Everything works from scratch.

### Benefits

They are listed in the previous 

### Possible Drawbacks 
1. `ed25519-cli` adds significant size to the repo. Maybe as soon as Bogdan (@Warchant) released it, we could download it from github.
2. It possibly might fail on Mac OS as `ed25519-cli` is not compiled in Mach-O format.

title: Add batch parser and transport factory
body:
<!-- You will not see HTML commented line in Pull Request body -->
<!-- Optional sections may be omitted. Just remove them or write None -->

<!-- ### Requirements -->
<!-- * Filling out the template is required. Any pull request that does not include enough information to be reviewed in a timely manner may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- * All new code must have code coverage above 70% (https://docs.codecov.io/docs/about-code-coverage). -->
<!-- * CircleCI builds must be passed. -->
<!-- * Critical and blocker issues reported by Sorabot must be fixed. -->
<!-- * Branch must be rebased onto base branch (https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/11173889/Rebase+and+merge+guide). -->


### Description of the Change
Remove transaction sequence usage from irohad, introduce
- TransactionBatchParser, which splits a list of transactions by possible adjacent batches
- TransportFactory interface and protobuf implementation, which allows to mock the deserialization step in tests
One boost header was copied with slight change to allow moving non-copyable parameters in ranges:

Before:
```C++
    template<typename Arg>
    R operator()(const Arg& arg) const
    {
        BOOST_ASSERT(m_impl);
        return (*m_impl)(arg);
    }
    template<typename Arg>
    R operator()(Arg& arg) const
    {
        BOOST_ASSERT(m_impl);
        return (*m_impl)(arg);
    }
```
After:
```C++
      template <typename Arg>
      R operator()(Arg &&arg) const {
        BOOST_ASSERT(m_impl);
        return (*m_impl)(std::forward<Arg>(arg));
      }
```
<!-- We must be able to understand the design of your change from this description. If we can't get a good idea of what the code will be doing from the description here, the pull request may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- Keep in mind that the maintainer reviewing this PR may not be familiar with or have worked with the code here recently, so please walk us through the concepts. -->

### Benefits
Less hardcoded dependencies
<!-- What benefits will be realized by the code change? -->

### Possible Drawbacks 
Code duplication in command service and mst transport, which will hopefully be resolved in another task

title: Wait for Postgres to become ready
body:
Signed-off-by: Artyom Bakhtin <a@bakhtin.net>

<!-- You will not see HTML commented line in Pull Request body -->
<!-- Optional sections may be omitted. Just remove them or write None -->

<!-- ### Requirements -->
<!-- * Filling out the template is required. Any pull request that does not include enough information to be reviewed in a timely manner may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- * All new code must have code coverage above 70% (https://docs.codecov.io/docs/about-code-coverage). -->
<!-- * CircleCI builds must be passed. -->
<!-- * Critical and blocker issues reported by Sorabot must be fixed. -->
<!-- * Branch must be rebased onto base branch (https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/11173889/Rebase+and+merge+guide). -->


### Description of the Change
- add wait-for-it.sh script
- modify entrypoint.sh to use wait-for-it.sh
- introduces new variables IROHA_POSTGRES_HOST and IROHA_POSTGRES_PORT
<!-- We must be able to understand the design of your change from this description. If we can't get a good idea of what the code will be doing from the description here, the pull request may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- Keep in mind that the maintainer reviewing this PR may not be familiar with or have worked with the code here recently, so please walk us through the concepts. -->

### Benefits
More reliable method to detect if Postgres is ready before running Iroha (which would fail otherwise)
<!-- What benefits will be realized by the code change? -->

### Possible Drawbacks 
IROHA_POSTGRES_HOST and IROHA_POSTGRES_PORT variables do not override ones defined in config file. In fact, we should manually check that they match. Otherwise, wait-for-it script just exits on timeout without an error. By that time Postgres most probably would be up and ready to accept connections.
But in case IROHA_POSTGRES_HOST is not defined, we just try to run `irohad` command straight off. This may fail as Postgres is not yet running.
As soon as https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/browse/IR-1567 is implemented, variables passed for `wait-for-it.sh` will also override ones defined in config file. Doing this we avoid having vain timeouts and run Iroha as soon as Postgres is ready.
<!-- What are the possible side-effects or negative impacts of the code change? -->
<!-- If no drawbacks, explicitly mention this (write None) -->

### Usage Examples or Tests
Save as docker/docker-compose.yml
```
version: '3'

services:
  iroha:
    image: hyperledger/iroha:develop
    environment:
      - IROHA_POSTGRES_HOST=some-postgres
      - KEY=node0
    volumes:
      - ./release/wait-for-it.sh:/wait-for-it.sh
      - ./release/entrypoint.sh:/entrypoint.sh
      - ../example:/opt/iroha_data
    tty: true

  postgres:
    image: postgres:9.5
    container_name: some-postgres
    environment:
      - POSTGRES_PASSWORD=mysecretpassword
```
<!-- Point reviewers to the test, code example or documentation which shows usage example of this feature -->

title: Jenkins on-demand AWS agents
body:
<!-- You will not see HTML commented line in Pull Request body -->
<!-- Optional sections may be omitted. Just remove them or write None -->

<!-- ### Requirements -->
<!-- * Filling out the template is required. Any pull request that does not include enough information to be reviewed in a timely manner may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- * All new code must have code coverage above 70% (https://docs.codecov.io/docs/about-code-coverage). -->
<!-- * CircleCI builds must be passed. -->
<!-- * Critical and blocker issues reported by Sorabot must be fixed. -->
<!-- * Branch must be rebased onto base branch (https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/11173889/Rebase+and+merge+guide). -->


### Description of the Change
- Replace static Jenkins build agents with on-demand ones
- Disable code coverage for all branches but `master`. It consumes a significant amount of time during the build, while coverage metric is not as useful as planned initially.
<!-- We must be able to understand the design of your change from this description. If we can't get a good idea of what the code will be doing from the description here, the pull request may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- Keep in mind that the maintainer reviewing this PR may not be familiar with or have worked with the code here recently, so please walk us through the concepts. -->

### Benefits
- Reduce infrastructure monthly bill by executing builds on AWS agents that are started up on-demand and shut down after a certain timeout if no builds are running on it
- Faster builds due to disabled coverage
<!-- What benefits will be realized by the code change? -->

### Possible Drawbacks 
- Slightly higher latency between "Start build" event sent to Jenkins and actual execution of the build as AWS agent requires some time for initialization. Although, not relevant in case an agent is already up and running
- `ccache` build cache is not available anymore as each agent starts up with a clean hard drive. However, this should not be a problem as the current utilization of the cache is pretty low already. That is because of many concurrent builds running on the same copy of the cache. The solution is to have a separate version of the cache for each PR/branch but that is not practically possible.
<!-- What are the possible side-effects or negative impacts of the code change? -->
<!-- If no drawbacks, explicitly mention this (write None) -->

title: Remove unnecessary template instantiations in YacGateImpl
body:
<!-- You will not see HTML commented line in Pull Request body -->
<!-- Optional sections may be omitted. Just remove them or write None -->

<!-- ### Requirements -->
<!-- * Filling out the template is required. Any pull request that does not include enough information to be reviewed in a timely manner may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- * All new code must have code coverage above 70% (https://docs.codecov.io/docs/about-code-coverage). -->
<!-- * CircleCI builds must be passed. -->
<!-- * Critical and blocker issues reported by Sorabot must be fixed. -->
<!-- * Branch must be rebased onto base branch (https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/11173889/Rebase+and+merge+guide). -->


### Description of the Change
Templight report for YacGateImpl showed that boost::variant templates for command type were instantiated. However, command type is unused in YacGate, so they should not be instantiated in compile time. Changes in this pull request remove these instantiations, and reduce the compile time from 400s to 60s according to Templight reports.

Main changes:
- Forward declarations instead of includes for interface command:
https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/blob/bcfb800ac296892624b9fb87f8b7ffcaf744199b/shared_model/interfaces/commands/command.hpp#L15-L30
- Extern templates:
https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/blob/bcfb800ac296892624b9fb87f8b7ffcaf744199b/shared_model/interfaces/commands/command.hpp#L79-L97
- Separate transaction sequence factory from transaction sequence to remove protobuf and validator dependency from shared model interfaces
- Remove proto backend usage in stateful validator
<!-- We must be able to understand the design of your change from this description. If we can't get a good idea of what the code will be doing from the description here, the pull request may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- Keep in mind that the maintainer reviewing this PR may not be familiar with or have worked with the code here recently, so please walk us through the concepts. -->

Note:
Why are exactly the following instantiations needed?
https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/blob/bcfb800ac296892624b9fb87f8b7ffcaf744199b/shared_model/interfaces/commands/impl/command.cpp#L27-L34
It is because they were the only templates reported by the compiler as undefined references.

### Benefits
- Shorter compile time
- More clear dependency separation
<!-- What benefits will be realized by the code change? -->

### Possible Drawbacks 
None
<!-- What are the possible side-effects or negative impacts of the code change? -->
<!-- If no drawbacks, explicitly mention this (write None) -->

title: Restrict storage lifetime in simulator and synchronizer
body:
<!-- You will not see HTML commented line in Pull Request body -->
<!-- Optional sections may be omitted. Just remove them or write None -->

<!-- ### Requirements -->
<!-- * Filling out the template is required. Any pull request that does not include enough information to be reviewed in a timely manner may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- * All new code must have code coverage above 70% (https://docs.codecov.io/docs/about-code-coverage). -->
<!-- * CircleCI builds must be passed. -->
<!-- * Critical and blocker issues reported by Sorabot must be fixed. -->
<!-- * Branch must be rebased onto base branch (https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/11173889/Rebase+and+merge+guide). -->


### Description of the Change
 - Restrict storage lifetime to callback in simulator and synchronizer. This prevents storage deadlocks, since resources are released before calling `on_next`, which in turn calls subscribers callbacks.
 - Refactor `operator|` bind calls and `match` calls to remove null pointers using `boost::get`.
<!-- We must be able to understand the design of your change from this description. If we can't get a good idea of what the code will be doing from the description here, the pull request may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- Keep in mind that the maintainer reviewing this PR may not be familiar with or have worked with the code here recently, so please walk us through the concepts. -->

### Benefits
No more deadlocks when storage connection is closed
<!-- What benefits will be realized by the code change? -->

### Possible Drawbacks 
`boost::get` calls are hard to read, a task will be created to refactor `Result` class.
<!-- What are the possible side-effects or negative impacts of the code change? -->
<!-- If no drawbacks, explicitly mention this (write None) -->

title: ITF checking statuses set
body:
### Description of the Change

ITF before only able to check, whether the sent tx is stateless valid or not (only the first status). This RP introduce the ITF feature to check against all the specified statuses, both for single transaction and tx sequence.

### Benefits

It is possible to check all statuses with one itf command, their order and responses content (e.g error message)

### Possible Drawbacks 

<s>Current implementation doesn't check the order of passed transaction. Is it an issue?</s>

### Usage Examples or Tests

As a usage example CreateRole::Basic acceptance test was reworked according to new ITF::sendTx.
Also for ITF::sendTxSequence there was reworked a fn call in BatchPipelineTest::InvalidAtomicBatch

title: Iroha Kubernetes
body:
<!-- You will not see HTML commented line in Pull Request body -->
<!-- Optional sections may be omitted. Just remove them or write None -->

<!-- ### Requirements -->
<!-- * Filling out the template is required. Any pull request that does not include enough information to be reviewed in a timely manner may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- * All new code must have code coverage above 70% (https://docs.codecov.io/docs/about-code-coverage). -->
<!-- * CircleCI builds must be passed. -->
<!-- * Critical and blocker issues reported by Sorabot must be fixed. -->
<!-- * Branch must be rebased onto base branch (https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/11173889/Rebase+and+merge+guide). -->


### Description of the Change
This PR introduces support for deploying Iroha on Kubernetes cluster. PR consists of two major components that configure instances and run Iroha service:
- Terraform: prepares infrastructure for deploying Kubernetes cluster. It deploys user-configurable number of EC2 nodes in multiple AWS regions (3 by default) and creates VPC peering between them for seamless communication
- Ansbile: there are two related roles
  1. kubespray. External module that deploys production-grade k8s cluster
   2. iroha-k8s. A role for generating configuration files for N Iroha nodes

Pod specification file can also be used for manual deployment. Terraform modules are ready for manual deployment as well if one needs it.
For more info regarding the structure and internals see README file in iroha-k8s Ansible role
There is also Deployment manual that describes the steps required for deploying k8s cluster from scratch and running Iroha service on it.

<!-- We must be able to understand the design of your change from this description. If we can't get a good idea of what the code will be doing from the description here, the pull request may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->
<!-- Keep in mind that the maintainer reviewing this PR may not be familiar with or have worked with the code here recently, so please walk us through the concepts. -->

### Benefits
Iroha can be deployed on Kubernetes cluster
<!-- What benefits will be realized by the code change? -->

None

### Description of the Change
Since timestamps of transactions are required to be validated against block or proposal timestamp, a separate method which has additional timestamp argument is required, because nested field validator is inaccessible.
Timestamp validation is removed from proposal and block because they require timestamp validation, which differs from transactions.

Unknown

title: Change log order
body:
### Description of the Change

Iroha used to produce something like:
```
[2018-08-28 14:24:40.335785000][th:295648][info] FairMstProcessor Propagate new data[2]
[2018-08-28 14:24:45.339160000][th:295648][info] FairMstProcessor Propagate new data[2]
[2018-08-28 14:24:50.330393000][th:295648][info] FairMstProcessor Propagate new data[2]
[2018-08-28 14:24:55.332114000][th:295648][info] FairMstProcessor Propagate new data[2]
[2018-08-28 14:25:00.328946000][th:295648][info] FairMstProcessor Propagate new data[2]
[2018-08-28 14:25:05.338611000][th:295648][info] FairMstProcessor Propagate new data[2]
[2018-08-28 14:25:10.332539000][th:295648][info] FairMstProcessor Propagate new data[2]
[2018-08-28 14:25:15.331939000][th:295648][info] FairMstProcessor Propagate new data[2]
```
even when there was no propagation. 

### Benefits

This PR fixes the order of logs.

### Possible Drawbacks 

None

title: Remove Duplication in Command Service
body:
### Description of the Change

This PR removes duplication in methods `Torii` and `ListTorii` by wrapping transactions into batches and processing them in a uniform way. Thus, method `TransactionProcessor::transactionHandle` was no longer needed and now removed.
The second thing done in this PR was that batches did not allow creation without transaction validation - for test purposes - due to lack of custom validators support. So, definitions of template methods of `TransactionBatch` were transferred into special `.hpp` file, allowing clients to extend them with their own validators - example of such extension can be found in `batch_helper.hpp`.

### Benefits

No code duplication and steps to the bright extendable future.

### Possible Drawbacks 

Please, pay attention that now `CommandService::Torii` calls `DefaultSignedTransactionValidator` twice: to create proto transaction and to create transaction batch. This is inappropriate, so suggestions to avoid this are accepted.

title: Synchroniser's onCommitChain() Rework
body:
### Description of the Change

Previously synchroniser - and thus PCS - emitted just observable on blocks, which could be empty. It was fine, but for new OS to work we need to be able to distinguish between received empty commit and a reject case, so interfaces and some logic were updated to reflect it.

### Benefits

Compatibility with coming ordering service.

### Possible Drawbacks 

More data to forward between components of the system.

### Description of the Change

The time showed us that the rest of torii_service_test s also require the fix for thread scheduling issues on slow machines like our CI environment. 

The idea behind the fix is emulating client behavior while getting tx statuses - resubscribing.

### Benefits

Passing tests in a various environments.
Test behavior now is a bit closer to the behavior of a real Iroha user.

None.

### Description of the Change
Implementation of connection manager component for on demand OS. Manager receives new peers and forwards the requests. Methods are thread safe.
It uses connection factory each time new peers are received, so that required peers are used with each update.
Shared lock is used to allow concurrent method calls and updates of peers.

title: added run-postgres-dev and stop-postgres-dev scripts
body:
Signed-off-by: tyvision <antykushin@gmail.com>

### Description of the Change

Since running a docker is not always required for local development, a postgresql instance could be enough for certain cases. First script `scripts/run-postgresql-dev.sh` starts the `postgresql` container. Second script `scripts/stop-postgresql-dev.sh` stops and removes the container and its dependencies such as volumes.

To stop:

title: Load Delay Removal
body:
### Description of the Change

After introducing consensus cache, load delay is no longer needed, because blocks, which are committed, get put to cache during voting, so asking peers for them is safe now.

### Benefits

No unnecessary delays.

### Possible Drawbacks 

None.

title: Consensus Cache in Block Loader and Yac Gate
body:
### Description of the Change

This PR is a result of merge of two tightly coupled PR-s - [1611](https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1611) and [1616](https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1616). It introduces a single block cache, to which consensus puts blocks after voting or committing, and block loader takes them from there, when it's asked to retrieve a block.

### Benefits

Process of downloading the last block becomes faster.

### Possible Drawbacks 

None.

### Description of the Change

Regression test may fail in case of ITF fail during the previous run (for some reason).
In that case, block store was not empty and nobody did its cleanup, because of the exception.

<!-- We must be able to understand the design of your change from this description. If we can't get a good idea of what the code will be doing from the description here, the pull request may be closed at the maintainers' discretion. -->

<!-- If no drawbacks, explicitly mention this (write None) -->

### Usage Examples or Tests

regression_test

<!-- Point reviewers to the test, code example or documentation which shows usage example of this feature -->

### Alternate Designs

Generally speaking, all the ITF tests need to be wrapped into test fixtures where the tearDown method will do block store cleanup for the cases when ITF throws an exception.

The suggested fix is a must-have fix for regression test because StateRecovery case does sequential initialization of two ITF instances. Any exception inside the first instance will prevent calling the destructor of the second instance and block store will be left dirty.

<!-- Explain what other alternates were considered and why the proposed version was selected -->

title: Synchronizer with Block Variant
body:
### Description of the Change

With this PR ability for Iroha to finally process empty blocks is added - now they are not committed to ledger, but still used to download chain, if something is missing.

### Benefits

Empty block pipeline ends.

### Possible Drawbacks 

None.

### Alternate Designs *[optional]*

During the development process I faced a problem: `iroha::visit_in_place(..)` method does not allow lambdas with capture parameters without copy constructors, because in implementation they are passed by value. I think, it can should be fixed, and lambdas could be passed by references, because in future we may clash with this problem again.

title: Fix ToriiService Streaming Full Pipeline Test
body:
Signed-off-by: Igor Egorov <igor@soramitsu.co.jp>

### Description of the Change

The test (StreamingFullPipelineTest) was failing on slow machines. 
Investigation showed that the root cause was the way thread scheduler works, so the code was generally valid.

Streaming client resubscription is a fully valid use case of streaming service.
The client can resubscribe to the stream if the previous stream was ended unexpectedly for the client.
Unexpectedly means that client requests the hash of a transaction that was definitely sent to Iroha and the stream reaches its end with one of the following statuses: `NOT_RECEIVED`, `STATELESS_VALIDATION_SUCCESS`, `STATEFUL_VALIDATION_SUCCESS`.

Before the fix test client was not able to resubscribe to the stream. Now it can.

### Benefits

Legal test client behavior is implemented.
The test is not failing.

### Possible Drawbacks 

None

### Usage Examples or Tests 

```diff
cmake -H. -Bbuild
cd build
make torii_service_test
while test_bin/torii_service_test --gtest_filter=*ull* ; do :; done
+this loop should not be broken up by ASSERT_EQ(last_status, COMMITTED) error message
```

title: Docker images push on existing develop branch PR
body:

<!-- * CircleCI builds must be passed. -->
<!-- * Critical and blocker issues reported by Sorabot must be fixed. -->
<!-- * Branch must be rebased onto base branch (https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/11173889/Rebase+and+merge+guide). -->


### Description of the Change
Fixes a rare case when Docker images are not pushed to Dockerhub. This happens when there is a PR for merging `develop` branch into `master` and changes are introduced into Dockerfile. The code in Jenkins file checks for branch name equals `develop` and pushes an image. This check fails when there is a PR opened as branch name in this case equals to something like `PR-****`. 
We now check for parent branch of a PR as well.

title: Use shared_ptr in tbb instead of unique
body:
### Description of the Change

<s>I don't really now why CI is able to compile it, but tbb::concurrent_queue doesn't really allow unique_ptr [due to try_pop signature](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee355358.aspx#concurrent_queue__try_pop_method)</s>

It seems that the issue is in clang & tbb itself referenced below

### Benefits

Able to compile with clang compiler

title: Add Storage for Pending Transactions
body:
Signed-off-by: Igor Egorov <igor@soramitsu.co.jp>

### Description of the Change

The storage listens to MST events and keeps track of semi signed transactions or batches of transactions. 
The storage is a backend for "getPendingTransactions" query. 
It returns all the transactions or batches of transactions created by query originator (single transactions or transactions from returned batches require more signatories to be processed).

### Benefits

Storage for pending transactions is implemented and covered by tests.

### Possible Drawbacks 

This PR cannot be compiled until corresponding changes will be made in MST.

### Usage Examples or Tests


```diff
cmake -H. -Bbuild
cmake --build build --target pending_txs_storage_test
cd build
ctest -R pending_txs_storage_test --output-on-failure
```

### Alternate Designs

Storage is not divided to interface and implementation since having just the implementation is acceptable in that case.

Potentially, internal structures can be replaced with `tbb::concurrent_{vector,hash_map}`. We use two maps as underlying structures and concurrent tbb structures would not solve the problem of simultaneous lock of both maps.

title: Hyperledger Iroha v1.0 beta-4 version
body:
In this release following changes were made:

## Faster throughput, pluggable state storage

There is less abstraction on state storage level, and validation is done with means of SQL queries. It has significantly improved the performance of Iroha peer and made it less error-prone (#1557). 

State storage is plugged over ORM library titled as SOCI, which bundles a nice thread pool for faster interconnection with PostgreSQL; and makes it possible to switch to other supported SQL storage (how about using in-memory SQLite database for even faster throughput? #1505)

## Stateful validation errors

All the stateful validation errors are printed in peer logs and response is sent to a client along with transaction status. Now it is a lot easier to check what went wrong with a rejected transaction (#1508)

**Important note:** this version of Iroha can disclose some personal data like account balance (if a transaction was statefully invalid —account can now get the reason). In the future version we will implement error codes ([check them there](https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/439189508/POW+N+075+Stateful+response))

## Binary Testing Framework 

This is a test framework that helps testing client libraries (now particularly in Python) if they produce valid transactions and queries (if permissions and other business rules were met #1485)

## Transaction status streaming over RxCpp

[Reactive extensions library in C++](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxCpp) is actively used in our architecture and now is in charge of transaction status processing (#1541)

## Input fuzzing

Libfuzz checks the input in our client component (called Torii) and protobuf messages are mutated as well (#1531) 

## Blocks and proposals are not copied now (and their creation process is benchmarked)

A proposal is a candidate for becoming the next block in Iroha chain. The lifetime of these objects is important, this is why their creation and copying has to be minimized by means of C++ (#1542, #1567)
Creation is benchmarked by means of Google Benchmark library (#1539)

## Check the size of signatures set 

One of the bugs, that was revealed with help of fuzzing, was a possibly valid empty signature set attached to a transaction. This behavior was fixed in #1536.

## API changes

### Transaction batch support 

Transaction batch is a set of transactions, which are to be applied together. There are two kinds of batches:
- Ordered batch
     - transactions will be applied strictly in the order they were received
- Atomic batch
    - the order is still guaranteed
    - failure of any transaction inside it leads to failure of the whole batch


**Important note:** this feature was not implemented completely in this release, however, interfaces and SDKs have already been changed for easier integration in the future. This does not affect backward compatibility.

Check the [status of development here](https://soramitsu.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IS/pages/378929159/POW+N+066+Batch+of+transactions)

### Amount is passed as a string. Everywhere

Code became much simpler and it is easier to create transactions without SDKs now (#1555)

### Proto files were split

Client API proto files now are stored in a shared model folder, whereas as Iroha peer messages are stored in schema folder (#1550)

### GetAccountDetail is a bit more powerful now

Check [our documentation page](http://iroha.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/queries.html#get-account-detail) 

### GetPendingTransactions

In order to make scenarios related to transaction batches and multisignature transactions easier Iroha has API endpoint to get transactions of transactions batches which require signing by participating accounts (#1532)

**Important note:** this feature was not implemented completely in this release, however, interfaces and SDKs have already been changed for easier integration in the future. This does not affect backward compatibility.

### Deleted account_id from Add/SubtractAssetQuantity commands 

Finally, we have deleted account_id from a previously confusing API in #1511

### Roles can have an empty set of permissions 

Now users can create empty roles for use cases where such a role can serve a purpose of a tag or the least powerful role in the system (#1510)


## Other

- Transaction status bus (#1575)
- Databases are purged and dropped after tests (#1406, #1584)
- Query execution can be mocked now (and tests are going to be much cleaner and easy to read) (#1579)
- Common objects factory (#1556)
- Builders are replaced with mocked Shared Model interfaces (#1563)
- WSV Query factories (instead of builders) (#1573)
- Refactor QueryProcessor interface (#1572)
- Block and proposal creation benchmarks (#1539)
- Proposal and block transactions validation (#1506)
- Add test cases for empty protobuf payload (#1502) 
- Jenkins build status badge link (#1551)
- Shared Model build status is fixed (#1576)
- Java binding fix (#1507, #1569)
- Color diagnostics in Jenkins CI (#1515)
- Reuse Peer proto (#1522)
- Fix tests for createRole with the empty set of permissions (#1520)
- Improve Findgrpc.cmake (#1518)
- WSV (blockchain state) in PostgreSQL stores permissions as bit strings (#1499)
- CLI values now are cached for convenience purposes (#1496) by contributor uditha-atukorala
- Removed grantable permissions in queries (#1500)
- Refactored TransferAsset test (#1482)
- Fix indentation in a code of error message in IP validator (#1514, #1513)
- Fix type incompatibility on 32-bit platforms in keys manager (#1503)
- Python example fix (#1529)
- Bind operator in TemporaryWsv files (#1544)

### Known issues

Windows build does not work at the moment, as well as JS bindings, due to their rough transition to new client libraries

title: Ordering Gate Batch Support
body:
### Description of the Change

Support for transaction batches was added to ordering gate, so that they are propagated through the pipeline, for now ending in ordering endpoint, from where in future PR it will be handled by ordering service.
Tests are not added, because there is no sense it testing propagation functions without implemented ordering service support.

### Benefits

More batch support.

### Possible Drawbacks 

None

body:
### Description of the Change

Remove amount_utils, since they aren't used

title: Replace QPF with QueryExecution mockable module
body:
### Description of the Change

QueryProcessingFactory cannot be replaced with other module, thus require more awful tests. It was replaced with [QueryExecution](https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1579/files#diff-4a10b1a4d097929c89c91047ee28f0bfR15) interface and [QueryExecutionImpl](https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1579/files#diff-d0edaef82aff7d12e0c37ead34dfb501R26) class (just copied previous implementation)

### Benefits

QueryExecution can be mocked, simpler tests, fuzzing test are fixed (also [find_fuzz is now correct](https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1579/files#diff-23e4183f2b17534d316a7b03e67dde7aR46))

### Possible Drawbacks

<s>[Explicit mutex lock](https://github.com/hyperledger/iroha/pull/1579/files#diff-58e46767b41a6f8204a5648afea65540R342) on each query</s>

title: Transaction Batches Stateful Validation
body:
### Description of the Change

Adds stateful validation checks for transaction batches:

1. If the transaction does not belong to any batch, proceed as usual
2. If the transaction belongs to ordered batch, in case of failure just move to the next transaction again
3. If the transaction belongs to atomic batch, failure of it leads to failure of all transactions in that batch

Also, tests for stateful validator and transaction batch validation were added.

### Benefits

Logic of transaction batches is improved.

### Possible Drawbacks 

Additional overhead for validation and WSV save points management.

### Alternative designs

Savepoint wrapper's design can be a theme of discussion. Shortly, I have decided to implement it as a nested structure of TemporaryWsv, because:
1. It cannot be used without temp WSV - there's just no sense in it
2. It must "see" some of private fields of temp WSV in order to function

There are two alternatives I see: declare it in some kind of temp WSV common file, and then either parametrize it with a template, or make necessary field of temp WSV friends to the wrapper. Both solutions, in my opinion, looks worse, than the one implemented
